questions.question: What is the main objective of the Stockholm Convention?
questions.answer: The main objective of the Stockholm Convention is to protect human health and the environment from persistent organic pollutants.

questions.question: What are Parties required to do to reduce or eliminate releases from intentional production and use of chemicals listed in Annex A?
questions.answer: Parties are required to prohibit and/or take legal and administrative measures necessary to eliminate the production and use of the chemicals listed in Annex A, subject to the provisions of that Annex.

questions.question: What measures must Parties take regarding stockpiles and wastes containing chemicals listed in Annex A, B, or C?
questions.answer: Parties must ensure that stockpiles and wastes containing chemicals listed in Annex A, B, or C are managed in a manner protective of human health and the environment.

questions.question: How often must Parties report on the measures they have taken to implement the provisions of the Stockholm Convention?
questions.answer: Parties must report to the Conference of the Parties on the measures they have taken to implement the provisions of the Stockholm Convention and on the effectiveness of such measures at periodic intervals decided by the Conference of the Parties.

questions.question: What is the role of the Persistent Organic Pollutants Review Committee?
questions.answer: The role of the Persistent Organic Pollutants Review Committee is to perform the functions assigned to it by the Convention, including examining proposals for listing new chemicals in Annexes A, B, and/or C.

questions.question: True or False: The Stockholm Convention allows for reservations to be made.
Under what conditions can a Party withdraw from the Stockholm Convention?
questions.answer: A Party can withdraw from the Stockholm Convention at any time after three years from the date on which the Convention has entered into force for that Party, by giving written notification to the depositary.

questions.question: True or False: The Stockholm Convention specifically addresses the issue of unintentional production of persistent organic pollutants.
What is required for an amendment to the Stockholm Convention to enter into force?
questions.answer: An amendment to the Stockholm Convention enters into force on the ninetieth day after the date of deposit of instruments of ratification, acceptance, approval, or accession by at least three-fourths of the Parties.

questions.question: What is the deadline for the elimination of the use of polychlorinated biphenyls (PCBs) in equipment according to the Convention?
questions.answer: The deadline for the elimination of the use of polychlorinated biphenyls (PCBs) in equipment is 2025, subject to review by the Conference of the Parties.
